subject: Photography
title: Dynamic Range: Lights and Shadows
description: A micro-lesson that makes Dynamic Range: Lights and Shadows usable.

hook.text: Your eyes can see details in bright clouds and dark shadows at the same time. Cameras struggle with that.

buildup.text: Dynamic range is the span between the brightest and darkest tones a camera can capture in one exposure.

discovery.text: Modern sensors capture about 14 stops of dynamic range. Your eyes manage roughly 20. The gap is real.

twist.text: HDR merges multiple exposures to simulate wider dynamic range. Your phone does this automatically now.

climax.text: Understanding dynamic range means knowing when to expose for highlights, shadows, or compromise between them.

punchline.text: Cameras see less than you. Expose wisely.

quiz.question: What is dynamic range in photography?
options: The span between the brightest and darkest tones a camera can capture
How fast the camera processes images
The range of focal lengths a lens covers
